intro: Euphrasia berggrenii, commonly known as Berggren's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and erect. Euphrasia berggrenii is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
